Recipe.title: Cherry-Chocolate Volcano Cake
Recipe.Description:
When there was a Dutch oven cook-off for desserts at a ward campout, Ransom tried doing a simple twist on upside-down cake. It was a huge hit!
As we tried to serve it, the Pie Filling started to drip down the side of the cake, thus the name.
The Ingredient amounts need to be validated.

section.instruction: Line the Dutch oven with tinfoil and butter the bottom and sides.
In a bowl, prepare Chocolate Cake Mix.
Open the Cherry Pie Filling and quickly place the can upside-down in the middle of the Dutch oven so as much as possible of the Filling is trapped in the can.
Pour about ¼th of the Cake Mix evenly around the outter edge of the Dutch oven.
Gently lift the Cherry Pie Filling can so the Filling stays piled as high as possible.
Pour the rest of the Cake Mix evenly around and over the top of the Pie Filling.
Slowly cook mostly from the top. Determine number of charcoal briquettes for top and bottom, and the approximate cook time.

Prepare a place to hold a hot Dutch oven lid so it will stay balanced but not damage the table it is on.
We generally do this by finding a couple of sticks and placing them about 6&inches; apart.
When it is cooked, carefully with very good pot-holder gloves, very quickly flip the entire Dutch oven, with the lid on, completely upside down.
Set Dutch oven, lid down, onto the place prepared, carefully remove the Dutch oven from the lid, then peel off the tinfoil.

Modifications.modification: For a 12&inch; Dutch oven, it takes about 1½ times this recipe, but we tend to just double it and use a deeper Dutch oven.
